intro: Trochocarpa, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has strap-like, linear leaves that are often evergreen, providing a lush backdrop to its vibrant blooms. Trochocarpa thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to produce showy flowers and attractive seed pods.
